snippet: In a sign of dissatisfaction at the troubled retail chain, the board of J.C. Penney gave Ron Johnson and other top executives no cash bonuses for 2012.
abstract: J C Penney board of directors slashes pay of chief executive Ron Johnson by almost 97 percent, to $1.9 million, for 2012, clear sign of dissatisfaction over direction of troubled company.

headline.main: J.C. Penney Slashes Pay of Its Chief
headline.print_headline: J.C. Penney Slashes Pay Of Its Chief

snippet: On land not cleared since the Civil War, the maple syrup flows and a dream takes root.
abstract: Robb Turner turned his Duchess County, NY, land into the largest maple syrup production facility in North America and he has created excitement about a sugaring industry in a state that has long struggled to grow one, despite its high concentration of maple trees; Turner is leading a drive to convince chefs and consumers that maple syrup is more than something to pour on pancakes, as can be seen in recipe for maple syrup flavored old-fashioned.

headline.main: Is It Too Classy for Pancakes?
headline.print_headline: Is It Too Classy for Pancakes?

snippet: Apple’s chief executive, Tim Cook, took the unusual step on Monday of apologizing to Chinese customers over the company’s warranty policy and said he would improve customer service in the country, David Barboza and Nick Wingfield report in Tuesday...
abstract: Apple’s chief executive, Tim Cook, took the unusual step on Monday of apologizing to Chinese customers over the company’s warranty policy and said he would improve customer service in the country, David Barboza and Nick Wingfield report in Tuesday’s New York Times.

headline.main: Daily Report: Pressured by China, Apple Apologizes for Warranty Policies

snippet: Spell-check can’t replace the keen eyes of an experienced editor. So, let’s put those keen eyes and experience to work, and eliminate some of these embarrassing mix-ups involving similar-sounding words. Many of these are pointed out by careful rea...
abstract: Spell-check can’t replace the keen eyes of an experienced editor. So, let’s put those keen eyes and experience to work, and eliminate some of these embarrassing mix-ups involving similar-sounding words. Many of these are pointed out by careful readers who expect better of us. Granted, the readers are not working on deadline — but they aren’t New York Times writers and editors, either.

snippet: Blackstone’s interest in Dell seems to raise more questions than it answers. | Joe Nocera says William A. Ackman has an angel on one shoulder and a devil on the other. | In a new special section, DealBook looks at women in finance. | An announceme...
abstract: Blackstone’s interest in Dell seems to raise more questions than it answers. | Joe Nocera says William A. Ackman has an angel on one shoulder and a devil on the other. | In a new special section, DealBook looks at women in finance. | An announcement by Tesla on Monday warrants a close look at how the company presents its numbers.

snippet: If J.C. Penney succumbs to its financial troubles, a shareholder activist will shoulder much of the blame.
A federal judge’s ruling could halt the resale of digital music as well as other digital good like e-books.
abstract: Federal Judge Richard J Sullivan in Manhattan rules that music reseller ReDigi's secondary market for digital tunes infringes on copyrights controlled by record companies; ruling is setback to nascent business of reselling digital goods like music and e-books.

headline.main: A Setback for Resellers of Digital Products
headline.print_headline: A Setback For Resellers Of Digital Products
